title: How to Grow Geraniums Indoors

steps.headline: Start with a healthy geranium of your choice.
Choose some good potting soil .
steps.description: Make sure that the soil is well drained.

steps.headline: Tap the plant out of its pot and check how root bound it is .
Transplant if it is very root bound then give it a larger pot.
steps.description: If it is not very root bound, give it a slightly larger pot.

steps.headline: Put in a sunny window.
steps.description: Window should be a west or south facing for best results. An east or north window will result in less to no blooms, but the plant will survive.

steps.headline: Water well to begin with.
steps.description: You should only need to water your plant when the soil is completely dry or close to that point.

steps.headline: Remove dead leaves as need arises.
steps.description: You can tell when leaves are ready to be removed by gently tugging them. If they come off, they are ready. If they do not, then wait a little longer. This will also work with the flower stalks.

steps.headline: Finished.
steps.description: Do not shade geranium.Give a bright, non-shaded window.

text: Start with a healthy geranium of your choice.  Choose a good pot.  Choose some good potting soil . Make sure that the soil is well drained. Tap the plant out of its pot and check how root bound it is .  Transplant if it is very root bound then give it a larger pot. If it is not very root bound, give it a slightly larger pot. Put in a sunny window. Window should be a west or south facing for best results. An east or north window will result in less to no blooms, but the plant will survive. Water well to begin with. You should only need to water your plant when the soil is completely dry or close to that point. Remove dead leaves as need arises. You can tell when leaves are ready to be removed by gently tugging them. If they come off, they are ready. If they do not, then wait a little longer. This will also work with the flower stalks. Finished. Do not shade geranium.Give a bright, non-shaded window.
sentences: Start with a healthy geranium of your choice.
Make sure that the soil is well drained.
Tap the plant out of its pot and check how root bound it is .
Transplant if it is very root bound then give it a larger pot.
If it is not very root bound, give it a slightly larger pot.
Window should be a west or south facing for best results.
An east or north window will result in less to no blooms, but the plant will survive.
You should only need to water your plant when the soil is completely dry or close to that point.
Remove dead leaves as need arises.
You can tell when leaves are ready to be removed by gently tugging them.
If they come off, they are ready.
If they do not, then wait a little longer.
This will also work with the flower stalks.
Do not shade geranium.Give a bright, non-shaded window.
